item.title: EFISTUB
item.description: So in this post I’m gonna guide you how you can use efistub, a feature which you can use to boot the kernel without an extra boot manager(grub, systemd-boot, rEFInd etc.) Create a boot entry using efibootmgr. # efibootmgr --create --disk /dev/sda --part 1 --label Debian --loader /vmlinuz --unicode "root=/dev/sda2 rw initrd=\initrd.img" --verbose Explaination of the command. --create 'creates a new boot entry' --disk 'disk where you wanna create the boot entry' --part 'partition number' --label 'the label for new entry' --loader 'loader to boot, it's vmlinuz in this example' --unicode 'kernel parameters you can define here like initrd, swap, encrypted container for root' --verbose 'let it verbose' I have an encrypted installation on my machine so here is how I create an entry for me.
